p: The Grimsel area (46°32′N, 8°16′E) is situated on gneiss and granodiorite bedrocks (Oberhänsli et al. 1988). The slopes in the Grimsel Valley are covered by various moraine deposits from the last maximum glacier advances that occurred between 1860 and 1920 (Ammann 1979). The plots are situated in the lower alpine belt, between 2310 and 2650 m a.s.l., and are characterized by mean annual temperature and precipitations of −0.44°C and 2071 mm, respectively (Zimmermann and Kienast 1999). The annual sum of fresh snow thickness decreased in average by 71.2 cm per decade, and the mean summer temperature rose by 0.41°C per decade between 1964 and 2011 (Grimsel Hospiz, 1980 m; Fig. 2 and Appendix S1).
